entry.title: Use the new STACK_ALLOCATED tool on ScopedNSAutoreleasePool
entry.content:
ScopedNSAutoreleasePool needs to be used strictly scoped. Use the

STACK_ALLOCATED tool to try to enforce this, and annotate the current

violations.



This CL also switches from using raw pointers to using

absl::optional. While that fixes some leaks, the resulting lifetimes

were wrong, so those needed to be adjusted.



This was originally landed as https://crrev.com/c/4844369. It turned

out that STACK_ALLOCATED became incompatible with raw_ptr, so uses of

raw_ptr with ScopedNSAutoreleasePool have been removed.



Bug: 1424190

entry.title: [DownloadBubble] Move ProgressInfo to DownloadDisplay
entry.content:
This moves the ProgressInfo struct to DownloadDisplay, as it needs to be

shared between //c/b/download/bubble and //c/b/ui. This moves it out of

DownloadDisplayController, where it didn't really make sense to have it

since it is produced by DownloadBubbleUpdateService and consumed by

DownloadDisplay.



This also makes it the controller's responsibility to push progress

updates to the view, rather than making the view fetch progress info

from the controller.



This does not yet cache ProgressInfo on the DownloadBubbleUpdateService

side, to reduce redundant computations, which will come in a later CL.



This is part of an effort to refactor/defrag the various pieces of the

download bubble UI code.



Bug: 1480146

entry.title: ProfileTokenQuality resetting for account profiles.
entry.content:
Project [1] adds logic to collect "observations" for the different

tokens stored in Autofill profiles (name, zip, city, etc). They

describe whether the tokens are accepted or edited after they were

filled, giving Autofill a way to understand the token quality.



When the value of a token changes, the corresponding observations need

to be reset, since they no longer reflect the correctness of the new

value.



For account profiles, this is tricky, since the profiles can be

modified by external integrators. This CL solves by problem in the

following way:

- Add a value_hash field to ContactInfoSpecifics::TokenMetadata. The

metadata is opaque to external integrators and already used to

store metadata about the tokens, like the observations and

verification statuses.

- The value_hash is set to a hash of the value that the metadata is

associated with on upload.

- Then updates through sync arrive, the value_hash can be compared

to the hash of the new value arriving through sync. If the hashes

differ, the value has changed and observations are reset.

In this case, no reupload to sync happens. See code comment in

contact_info_sync_util.cc.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-hoBeCogz8gewu3rfhRNGTWObqWfwSSNZ29ikYGml2I/edit?resourcekey=0-vK0gJwbg5cmepJJHBGCC7g



Bug: 1453650

Change-Id: I8ffbc0e17901bb0791ae39b2d69525abc115a8b6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4853700

previously.

entry.title: Simplify construction mechanism of AutofillProvider.
entry.content:
Prior to this CL, the base class, AutofillProvider, attached itself

to the WebContents in its constructor. This meant that derived classes

would have to be instantiated using new and that the resulting pointer

was already owned elsewhere.



This changes mirrors the setup of, e.g., ContentAutofillClient and

ChromeAutofillClient. While the parent class is WebContentsUserData

(which is convenient for embedders that only deal with the base class),

it does not pass ownership of itself to the WebContents. That part is

left to the classes extending it.



This way, the following pattern works:

// Creation:

AutofillProviderAndroid::CreateForWebContents(contents);



// Use elsewhere:

AutofillProvider::FromWebContents(contents)->DoSomething()



Bug: 1478934

Change-Id: I037f342fa1c04cca4832d08c1a7c97b98ffaa07a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4863562

Reviewed-by: Dominic Battre

entry.title: Revert "Deprecate dangling markup in target name by default"
entry.content:
This reverts commit c0f809852dc797ae11ba13ed02974b622c1fe869.



Reason for revert: I am gardening, this seems to have caused test

failures on linux MSAN: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20MSan%20Tests



Original change's description:

> Deprecate dangling markup in target name by default

>

> This change ships deprecation of the dangling markup in target name[1].

> This is reland of crrev.com/c/4848468. The failing test was fixed by

> changing the page which has a body element (empty.html seemed to fail in

entry.title: [Element Capture #6] Fix capture of partially offscreen elements
entry.content:
This patch resolves an issue where Elements that are partially drawn offscreen do not get captured at all. This is due to some checks that assume the captured render pass is entirely within the root render pass' coordinates. While the element's render pass contents get properly clipped (so if you captured the entire pass the offscreen portion would be painted black), the size of the render pass remains unchanged. This is resolved by taking the render pass output_rect in system B, translating to system A to intersect with the frame size, then translating back to system B for capturing a subsection of the render pass.



The Project:

For more information, Googlers may visit: go/element-capture



All developers are welcome to visit the W3 spec page at:

https://screen-share.github.io/element-capture/



Coming Up Next:

* Bug fixing and stabilizations.

* Working with eladlon@ to replace the hack with the proper

restrictTo API.

entry.title: [PA] Change |AllocNoHooks| to |Alloc<kNoHooks>|
entry.content:
This is a refactoring change to PA. This change should affect only

inline-ness of |AllocNoHooks| calls in tests.



- Make |AllocNoHooks| private

- Allow using |kNoHooks| in |Alloc| (or |AllocInternal|)

- There should be no overhead because all conditional branching is

performed at compile-time.

- Rewrite all |AllocNoHooks| usage to:

- |Alloc| if in tests

- |AllocInline| otherwise



Context:

Historically |AllocNoHooks| existed to make hook-less allocation

faster by omitting some conditional branching based on allocation

flags. However, https://crrev.com/c/4750750 constexpr-nized flags

so there is no performance overhead.

Making it private makes allocation flow and PA's API more simple.

entry.title: Consistently use index instead of virtual id in AutofillProvider.
entry.content:
AutofillProvider.isDatalistField expects the (0-based) index of a

form field in its form. However, it is currently called with

the child's virtual id inside notifyVirtualViewEntered and

notifyVirtualViewExited.



This is a bug that would result in an out of bounds exception

if it were not for the fact the the lower 16 bit of the virtual

id correspond to the field index and isDatalistField casts

its int argument to a 16-bit short.



This CL moves all notifyVirtualView* methods of AutofillProvider

to take field indices instead of field virtual ids.

entry.title: [webview][multi-profile] Implement AwContents Set & Get Profile
entry.content:
This CL adds the `setBrowserContext()` method to `AwContents. The

`AwContents` state is captured before the browser context is changed and

restored after the fact. This functionality has been tested using the

WebView Shell.



`AwContents#setBrowserContext()` will throw an `IllegalStateException`

in the following scenarios:



* The WebView has been destroyed via. `WebView#destroy()`

* The WebView has been navigated (i.e. loaded a web page)

* `AwContents#setBrowserContext(AwBrowserContext)` has been called

previously (i.e. we only allow setting the profile once)

* `AwContents#getBrowserContext()` has been called (i.e. the app may

have a reference the WebView's current profile).

* `AwContents#evaluateJavascript has been called previously`



Integration tests have been added for all of the above scenarios along

with the following:



* The `AwBrowserContext` is actually set to the correct one.

* The `AwCookieManager`s used by separate `AwContents` objects running

different profiles are the correct ones.



Bug: 1467232

Change-Id: Ib6cd210024ca1c79b5cff1b32239fd66346b8f53

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4843009

Commit-Queue: Wayne Jackson Jr.

Reviewed-by: Richard (Torne) Coles

entry.title: Require additional bid owners to be in interestGroupBuyers.
entry.content:
Before this change, the policy only required an additional bid owner to

be in interestGroupBuyers for their negative interest groups to be

loaded. However, this causes an unexpected error scenario. If an

additional bid owner is not in interestGroupBuyers, its negative

interest groups won't be loaded. As a result, if that buyer submits

additional bids negatively targeted against one or more negative

interest groups, those additional bids will *always* be allowed into the

auction, even when the buyer intends for those bids to be suppressed by

the presence of the negative interest groups. After this change, the

default behavior changes, so that omitting an additional bid owner from

interestGroupBuyers means that their additional bid will *never* be

allowed into the auction.



Change-Id: I60613b5cb53d4c73aee5723b57053b56b7696e61

Bug: 1464874

entry.content:
This patch refactors `text-autospace-001.html` so that it

computes the expected advances from advances without auto-

spacing. Before this patch, it assumed the character before

has the same advance. Eliminating this assumption allows

adding more test cases.

so it was split to a new separate test.

entry.title: [iOS] Skip History Sync if optional and declined too often
entry.content:
The history sync promo should not be shown too frequently to the users.

In the flow for which history sync is optional, the opt-in screen should

be skipped if any user declined it in the past 2 weeks, or twice in a

row.



This CL adds a new HistorySyncSkipReason for History Sync flows

for this case, combined to a isOptional parameter for related

coordinators that is set for each entry point.



It also updates the EGTest utils to reset the prefs, and avoid the

skip to happen in the tests.

entry.title: Mark checking ComputeContentSize optimization expensive
entry.content:
This `DCHECK` is quite expensive, not intended to be enabled

on user machines, while still useful when making a big changes

to the inline algorithms such as adding a new property.



This patch marks it as `EXPENSIVE_DCHECKS_ARE_ON` so that it's

not enabled even when `DCHECK` is enabled.

It's correct that Sync users should not have account passwords. The Sync

status is checked in real time on the UI thread. The number of account

passwords however comes from another thread that can be stuck for a

minute. Thus, the condition is mostly true and should not be DCHECHed.

entry.title: [dPWA] Partition preinstalled web app configs into install, uninstall and ignore
entry.content:
This CL adds a kIgnore install decision for preinstalled web app

configs.

This is a safer version of kUninstall where the user's app install

state is left alone rather than having the app uninstalled when

configs become disabled.



There have been past bugs relating to preinstalled web apps getting

disabled and being wiped from the device, see crbug.com/1393284 and

crbug.com/1363004 for past incidents. By making uninstallation an

explicit decision for just the config parameters that need it this

reduces the severity of general config related bugs.



Bug: 1409355

Change-Id: I67ad8f48669008f7c1bfe1704958c5ababcf3538

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4833875

entry.title: [MailboxVideoFrameConverter] SetPrefersExternalSampler() on Linux
entry.content:
Linux is now ready to use MultiplanarSI for hardware video decoding. The

relevant flow occurs when Linux is using NV12 with Vulkan [1]). In that

case, it creates SharedImages via MailboxVideoFrameConverter. This CL

changes MailboxVideoFrameConverter to invoke SetPrefersExternalSampler()

on multiplanar SI formats for Linux as well as ChromeOS. This is the

only change that appears to be required to enable experimentation with

multiplanarSI for hardware video decode on Linux:



- ToVkFormat() on the SharedImage side has been updated to handle

multiplanar formats with external sampling, and all callers of

ToVkFormat() that would receive multiplanar VkFormats when using

multiplanar SI for hardware video decode are already receiving those

formats in the current flow and thus have support for them

- Other callers of SetPrefersExternalSampler() in the codebase

(VideoResourceUpdater and VideoCaptureImpl) guard it via

BUILDFLAG(IS_OZONE) and hence will transparently work with Linux



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/mojo/services/gpu_mojo_media_client_linux.cc;l=38-41;drc=064f82bf9239232b1619ca68a7487425f7cc328c



Bug: 1471111

Change-Id: Id491617564c7615359006250203ac6810871fa9e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4846829

entry.title: [Sync] Make incoming password sharing invitations low priority
entry.content:
This CL adds INCOMING_PASSWORD_SHARING_INVITATION data type to low

priority types. This is required to make it sure that Password data type

is initialized during the initial sync first, to prevent storing any

incoming passwords before all the other user passwords are stored

locally. This is required to prevent password overwriting during the

initial merge.



This CL also added two new integration tests to verify handling invitations during the initial sync, and that the password from Password data type is not overwritten.

entry.title: CCA: Change AsyncJobQueue.push to not return promise
entry.content:
Since most caller that use AsyncJobQueue for proper sequencing of async

operations and don't explicitly wait on the job to finish, and relies on

unhandled promise rejection for error reporting, the API is more user

friendly if we return a struct instead of a promise directly, to avoid

floating promise warning on use.



`cca.py lint --eslintrc .eslintrc_floating_promise.js` error count goes

down from 64 to 60.

entry.title: [AWC] Add `resizable` CSS @media feature
entry.content:
The new `resizable` CSS will enable using CSS or JS @media query to know

if the window can be resized or not. The value is a `boolean` defaulting

to `true`, as the actual value retrieval from widget is implemented in

follow-up CLs.



Usage examples:



```css

@media (resizable: false) {

/* CSS to be applied */

}

```



```js

window.matchMedia('(resizable: false)').matches

```



I2P thread

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/oCxWg8q_OQY/m/LUTw0T5cCQAJ



Public explainer is available @

https://github.com/ivansandrk/additional-windowing-controls/blob/main/awc-explainer.md



Private doc @ go/additional-windowing-controls

entry.title: Fix extension caching for very long account ids
entry.content:
If an account id was longer than 255 characters installing extensions

was broken since this would attempt to create a folder with a name

longer than the file system supports.



Since we simply use a full URL as account id for PWA kiosk apps,

we hit this limit if the URL is long enough.



Fixed: b/299345973

entry.title: [text-autospace] Use a flag in `ShapeResult` to handle line breaking
entry.content:
This patch implements a new way to remove auto-spacing at the

line breaking points.



crrev.com/c/4826308 implemented it by making the glyphs as

unsafe-to-break. This turned out to be not great for:

1. Reshaping can remove auto-spacing at the line-end, but it

also removes auto-spacing of the first character in the

wrapped line.

2. The performance hit of reshaping turned out to be more than

expected.



This patch undoes crrev.com/c/4826308, and adds a flag to

`ShapeResultCharacterData`. While `HarfBuzzRunGlyphData`

doesn't have spare bits, `ShapeResultCharacterData` has spare

bits, and the auto-spacing is per character, not per glyph.



Bug: 1463890

Change-Id: I1dee11f114e94872806e77e78f9d1d66f5a8e133

entry.title: [AutofillDataModel] Moves legacy classes into i18n hierarchies.
entry.content:
As part of the autofill i18n project, the legacy hierarchy will be

served via the i18n API by dynamically building the hierarchy.



To reach that goal this CL updates the current legacy classes, which

now support a more dynamic way of registering children. To accomplish

this we have merged the `I18nAddressComponent` into

`AddressComponent`, hence importing the same way of creating nodes.



When creating the dynamic hierarchy, each field type is now mapped to

an instance of the corresponding class. Note that this means that if

the field type trees are equivalent then the legacy hierarchy matches

fully.



Bug: 1464568

entry.title: Privacy Sandbox: Fix intersectionRatio check in PS dialog
entry.content:
Privacy Sandbox dialog "Show more" logic relies on an

IntersectionObserver reporting the intersection ratio between the last

text element and its container. The intersectionRatio is supposed to be

equal to 1 when the last element is completely visible: in that case we

know the bottom of the page was reached and the show button can be

hidden. Sometimes intersectionRatio value is reported as 0.99 making

the logic fail: the "More" button stays visible and its overlay is

covering the action buttons. This CL changes the intersectionRatio check

and makes is less strict, waiting for crbug.com/1020466 to be fixed.



Bug: 1482215, b/299120185

entry.title: Roll libc++ from 84fb809dd6da to 68a6f0b88287 (352 revisions)
entry.content:
https://chromium.googlesource.com/external/github.com/llvm/llvm-project/libcxx.git/+log/84fb809dd6da..68a6f0b88287



This brings in a change that changes how libc++'s assertion mode

works. Instead of _LIBCPP_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS there's now

_LIBCPP_ENABLE_SAFE_MODE and _LIBCPP_ENABLE_HARDENED_MODE.

_LIBCPP_ENABLE_HARDENED_MODE only has security checks.

_LIBCPP_ENABLE_SAFE_MODE is virtually identical to

_LIBCPP_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS at the moment, but upstream

wants to remove some asserts from it in the future.

So we'll have to keep an eye on that and make sure none we want

get dropped. https://crbug.com/1465186 has more details.



(This here doesn't update the pnacl-saigo libc++ version, so

that still uses the old _LIBCPP_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS mode.)



The update also deprecates basic_string. For now

that's behind an

`if !defined(_LIBCPP_CHAR_TRAITS_REMOVE_BASE_SPECIALIZATION)`

but it will be removed in the future. So we'll also have to

remove the uses of that (there aren't that many, but one is

in jnipp which is used by openexr, so that'll take some time

to update), and then define

`_LIBCPP_CHAR_TRAITS_REMOVE_BASE_SPECIALIZATION`. This is

https://1481891.



So there's some follow-up to do after this rolls in.

entry.title: GWP-ASan: Add feature map
entry.content:
We intend to expand the GWP-ASan Android experiment to include WebView.

WebView experiments must add a flag to

`ProductionSupportedFlagList.java`. To do so, we need to expose the two

GWP-ASan `base::Feature`s to Java. This CL plumbs together the

boilerplate to do so.



This change was generated by following

`android_accessing_cpp_features_in_java.md`.



Bug: b/287426302

Low-Coverage-Reason: Trivial JNI glue

entry.title: ozone/wayland: Initialize WaylandBufferManagerGpu with bug fix ids
entry.content:
This CL lets WaylandBufferManagerConnector initialize

WaylandBufferManagerGpu with bug fix ids.



Bug fix ids are sent from the server asynchronously and stored in

zaura_shell, so it needs to wait until all bug fix ids are sent. We can

confirm all bug fix ids are sent by receiving `bug_fix_done` event.



Bug: 1480226

entry.title: Revert "Fix and re-enable the calendar ResetToTodayWithAnimation test"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 32c7516a5b9fa0f41e84967f570a373b15dcb567.



Reason for revert: The test is still flaky. See crbug.com/1482615



Original change's description:

> Fix and re-enable the calendar ResetToTodayWithAnimation test

>

> There are a lot of nested animations (one animation starts on another

> animation's OnAnimationComplete) in the calendar animations. So

> the `FastForwardBy` method dose not always work as expected in the

> test runtime.

>

> This cl uses `ui::LayerAnimationStoppedWaiter` instead of

> `task_environment()->FastForwardBy` in this animation test to make sure

> an animation is finished.

>

> Bug: b/252308184

> Change-Id: Ia089a41244dff6c1f8e2f535c24ce65bf5e6e59e

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4862733

> Commit-Queue: Jiaming Cheng

> Reviewed-by: Ahmed Mehfooz

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1196323}



Bug: b/252308184, 1482615

Change-Id: Ib7e670c8b11570ae8b416a5ebc2939f07e6329c0
